intro: Senecio albotectus, commonly known as the white-veined groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive white or pale green vein pattern. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Senecio albotectus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
